screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .qxp file in QuarkXPress 2020
screenshot.caption: QXP file open in QuarkXPress 2020

description: QuarkXpress enables you to design a wide range of published print materials, such as flyers, newspapers, catalogs, and content for websites and mobile applications. Quark Software introduced the QXP project file type when it released version 6 of QuarkXpress, replacing the .QXD file type used by prior versions of QuarkXPress.

When working on a design, you can save it as a QXP project, close it, then re-open it for further editing. To create a QXP file with QuarkXpress, select File → New → Project... , choose the settings, click OK , then select File → Save or Save As... .

images.alt: Screenshot of a .qxp file in QuarkXPress 2020
images.caption: QXP file open in QuarkXPress 2020
